channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A judge to weigh in on SNAP benefits. And, Trump wants to resume nuclear testing
item.description: A federal judge is set to decide whether the Trump administration will have to find funds to keep SNAP benefits flowing. And, President Trump says the...

item.title: The Trump administration move to study aluminum in vaccines worries scientists
item.description: Aluminum has been added to certain vaccines for decades to boost their effect on the immune system, and has been shown to be safe. But, the Trump admi...

item.title: Families say cost of housing means they'll have fewer or no children
item.description: Western states have some of America's lowest fertility rates. The rapidly rising cost of housing is playing a role.

item.title: It's not for Halloween — it's Comic Con, where Black and Caribbean cosplayers find community
item.description: Black and Caribbean cosplayers are redefining what community looks like at New York Comic Con.

item.title: 5 key takeaways from Trump's week in Asia
item.description: President Trump is back in Washington after spending a week in Asia. He attended the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, addressed U.S. troops in Japan and ...

item.title: Dutch centrist Rob Jetten wins neck-and-neck election race, vote analysis says
item.description: Rob Jetten's D66 is the biggest party in Wednesday's election, according to vote analysis indicating it cannot be beaten.

item.title: School crossing guards face life-threatening dangers on the job

item.description: The National Retail Federation says this year's Halloween spending on costumes, decorations, candy and greeting cards is expected to hit more than $13...

item.title: Hurricane death toll rises as Jamaica aid effort struggles
item.description: The devastating storm claimed nearly 50 lives when it swept Haiti and Jamaica this week.

item.title: FBI says "potential terrorist attack" thwarted in Michigan, multiple arrests
item.description: In a social media post​, FBI Director Kash Patel said multiple suspects who were allegedly plotting a violent attack were arrested in Michigan.

item.title: What are the best ways to cut credit card debt before the holidays? Here's what experts think.
item.description: Don't let high-rate credit card balances drag you down this holiday season. Here's how to handle that debt instead.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (Nov. 2)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Ohio commission and Virginia lawmakers consider moves toward mid-decade congressional redistricting
item.description: Mid-cycle congressional redistricting efforts could move forward Friday in two more states amid maneuvering to influence which party will control the ...

item.title: U.S. troop drawdown in eastern Europe brings anxiety, and GOP rebuke
item.description: NATO and U.S. allies try to assuage fears over bolstering Russia as the Pentagon announces a U.S. troop reduction in eastern Europe.

item.title: ‘It’s home': Caribbean diaspora from Miami to New York fuels Hurricane Melissa relief efforts
Election protesters defy army chief in third day of Tanzania unrest
item.description: Some deaths have been reported though accurate figures are hard to obtain due to the internet shutdown.

item.title: US strikes on alleged drug boats violate law, UN human rights chief says
item.description: Volker Türk said the strikes were "unacceptable" and urged Washington to halt them immediately.

item.title: Watch: Train smashes into truck at Dutch level crossing
item.description: Five people sustained minor injuries but nobody was seriously hurt in the incident in Meteren.
